channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 26th September
item.description:
Large branch hanging down into the carriageway.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage pipes are damaged, 26th September
item.description:
You attended site today to clear the storm drains on the road. The gentlemen who attended said they were unable to clear the storm drains because the drains are clearly damaged under the road and that the road needs to be dug up and repairs or a replacement of the storm drain made. This is clearly the cause of the ongoing flow of water at road level which has caused multiple large potholes which have a constant supply of water from them. When cars drive through the potholes the whole front of our house is splashed- windows, door, us, pedestrians- you name it! When they were trying to clear the blockage they inadvertently caused our front garden to flood- we now have a lot of silt and this is causing major damp ingress into our house. PLEASE address the underlying issue with the broken storm drains under the road once and for all. This issue is serious!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62C, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling around public fields, 26th September
item.description:
I regularly walk my dog around the fields shown in the attached screenshot, and unfortunately there is an increasing problem with dog mess along this route. I now have to watch my step constantly. In addition, some people are bagging their dog waste but then leaving the bags in hedges rather than using a bin. I’ve marked with an “X” on the map where this is happening most often. I’m not sure what can be done, but it is spoiling the area for everyone. Perhaps some polite reminder signs encouraging responsible behaviour, along with directions to the nearest dog waste bin, could help improve things. Thank you for looking into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Larimar Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
